question_text: Two equal bulbs, one containing ammonia and the other nitrogen are opened mouth-to-mouth to each other at room temperature. The entropy in the mixture of gases is likely to
subject: chemistry
explanation: Thanks to the second law of thermodynamics, we know that the entropy of the final mixture has to be equal to or greater than the initially isolated systems. This means that the answer cannot be that the entropy decreases. Equality occurs just when the two original systems have all their respective intensive variables (temperature, pressure) equal; then the final system also has the same values. If we were dealing with two identical gases, then the answer would have been that the entropy will remain unchanged.

question_text: A small quantity of solid ammonium chloride (NH4Cl) was heated gently in a test tube, the solid gradually disappears to produce two gases. Later, a white cloudy deposit was observed on the cooler part of the test tube. The ammonium chloride is said to have undergone
subject: chemistry

question_text: What volume of 0.5 MH2SO4 will exactly neutralize 20cm3 of 0.1 MNaOH Solution?
subject: chemistry

question_text: Calculate the relative molecular mass of Limestone CaCO3, (Ca = 40, C =12, O = 16)
subject: chemistry
explanation: One molecule of CaCO has 1Ca, 1C and 30 atom relative molecular mass of CaCO31 × Ar of Ca +1 × Ar of C +3 × Ar of O(1 × 40 + 1 × 12 + 3 × 1)40 + 12 + 48=100Option A,C and D will not give 100

question_text: One note of a hydrocarbon 36g of carbon and its density is 20. The structure of hydrocarbon is (organic chemical)
subject: chemistry
explanation: 2VD = RmmVD = Vapour Density, Rmm = relative2 × 20 − 40 molecular massMole of carbon − 36/12= 3Mole of H2 = 40 − 36= 4The compound contains 3mole of carbon and 4 hydrogen

question_text: 5 block elements of the periodic table one made up of
subject: chemistry
explanation: 5 block elements only are made up of group 1 and 2 options A,C,D takes place of the other blocks in the periodic table p,d,f etc.

question_text: The principal constituent of natural gas is
subject: chemistry
explanation: Methane CH4.A. is the principal and commercial constituent natural gas. Option B,C,D are also constituent of natural gas but they are not commercial and of economic importance

question_text: Rare gases are suitable because they
subject: chemistry
explanation: Rare gases are stable because they have duplet or octet electronic configurations in the outermost shells in their atoms, as a result they don’t go into solution easily. option A, B, Dare not because they go into solution easily (unstable)

options.answer: have duplet or octet electronic configuration in the outermost shells in their atoms

question_text: Electronic configuration of an elements 13x in the subsidiary energy level is
subject: chemistry

question_text: Alloys are best prepared by
subject: chemistry
explanation: Alloy is a metal that consist of two or more metals mixed together e.g. is mass which is an alloy of copper and zinc. Are not prepared with option A,B,C, and the do not result in mixture and metals together

options.answer: reducing and mixture of their metallic
cooking a molten of the metals

subject: chemistry
explanation: Helium has the greatest ionization energy because they are less stable. Options B,C,D have low ionization energy because one more stable and do not react easily

question_text: Which of these require crystallization most?
subject: chemistry
explanation: Crystallization is required the most in industries where the purity of their products is important e.g in the manufacture of drugs and in sugar production. Options B,C and D do not undergo crystallization

question_text: The oxidation state of oxygen in tetraoxosulphate (VI) acid is
subject: chemistry
explanation: H2SO4(O.N of hydrogen * 2 ) + O.N of sulphur + O.N of oxygen * 4 = 0∴ 1 * 2 + 6 + 4x = 02 + 6 + 4x = 08 + 4x = 04x 0 - 8 = -84x = -8x = -8/4 = -2

question_text: Tartaric acid is used industrially to
subject: chemistry
explanation: Tartaric acid is a white, crystalline organic acid that occurs naturally in many fruits, most notably in grapes, but also in bananas, tamarinds, and citrus. Its salt, potassium bitartrate, commonly known as cream of tartar, develops naturally in the process of winemaking. It is commonly mixed with sodium bicarbonate and is sold as baking powder used as a leavening agent in food preparation.

question_text: The fuming of kettles is caused by the presence in the water of
subject: chemistry
related_lessons: The Electrolysis of Aqueous Sodium Chloride
explanation: The furring of kettles or boilers is as a result of the decomposition of Ca(HCO3)2 into CaCO3, and this coats the inside of a kettle or boiler used in heating water containing dissolved Ca(HCO3)2.
